projects.title: Unibo Motorsport (Driverless Division)
projects.description: Autonomous race car control systems. Computer vision, path planning, velocity and steering control. Full stack in C++ on embedded Linux with strict real-time constraints.

projects.title: Aurora Rocketry
projects.description: Guidance, Navigation & Control for rockets. IMU/GPS sensor fusion, Extended Kalman Filter state estimation, PID controls for control surfaces.

projects.title: Monolith
projects.description: Monolith is a drop-in replacement for the standard library's memory allocation functions (malloc, free, and calloc). This project serves as a deep dive into low-level systems programming, demonstrating robust heap management, precise pointer arithmetic, and effective strategies to combat memory fragmentation.

projects.title: Poetr-AI
projects.description: PoetrAI is a haiku poetry generation software, the first of its kind. The project was developed entirely in Python and uses the first fine-tuning techniques on OpenAI's GPT-2 model.

articles.title: Why Low-Level Still Matters
articles.excerpt: In a world of abstractions and high-level frameworks, understanding how the machine actually works is what separates a programmer from a systems engineer.
articles.content:
In a world of abstractions and high-level frameworks, understanding how the machine actually works is what separates a programmer from a systems engineer.

articles.title: Real-Time Systems in Rockets
articles.excerpt: When you have 10ms to decide if your rocket needs to correct trajectory, every clock cycle counts. No garbage collection, no dynamic allocation, no debugger.
articles.content:
When you have 10ms to decide if your rocket needs to correct trajectory, every clock cycle counts. No garbage collection, no dynamic allocation, no debugger.

articles.title: Driverless: Software That Must Work
articles.excerpt: In autonomous motorsport there are no beta versions. The code either works or it doesn't. A race car at 100 km/h won't wait for you to deploy a hotfix.
articles.content:
In autonomous motorsport there are no beta versions. The code either works or it doesn't. A race car at 100 km/h won't wait for you to deploy a hotfix.

articles.title: AI and Embedded Systems: The Future
articles.excerpt: Artificial intelligence doesn't just live in the cloud. The future is bringing AI where it's needed: drones, robots, cars, medical devices.
articles.content:
Artificial intelligence doesn't just live in the cloud. The future is bringing AI where it's needed: drones, robots, cars, medical devices.
